result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin Bernard Seiler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devin Bernard Seiler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Devin Bernard Seiler was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Pepin County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I will consent to random drug testing at the direction of the DA's office.
B.  I will complete 40 hours of community service through the Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC.

supervisions.notes:

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P&P Agent Theis appears in court.  Atty Larimore confirms receipt of Revocation Order & Warrant and reviewed with his client in 15CM60.  DPA on felony charge now revoked.  DOC not revoking on the 2 misdemeanor charges associated with the felony.  State recommends 3 yrs probation on felony and ask court to consider 60 days jail, defendant served 50 days already; State unsure how agency arrived at recommended 5 mos. on THC charge; jail on felony run concurrent to THC understandable.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and there are no victim impact statements.  Atty Larimore asks court to consider less than 5 mos. on marijuana charge; notes this is his client's first felony conviction, don't believe this is a prison case; his client requests another chance on probation and appreciates P&P not revoking him on other charges.  Letter from defendant presented to the court.  Off record for court to read letter.  On record.  Defendant addresses the court.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs probation consecutive to the 5 mos. jail in 15CM60; this sentence with start after jail sentence; pay costs of case; provide a DNA sample; no contact provision same as in misdemeanor case; comply with any assessment or counseling as set up by P&P; demonstrate responsibility by seeking or maintaining F/T employment, education or voluntere activities; advised of felony prohibitions.  P&P not revoking on the 2 battery charges.  To the THC charge, sentence to 5 mos. in the PCJ with 87 days credit with good time and with huber; enter judgment for unpaid obligations.  Advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing request by PO Agent who sent letter re: violations of probation and requests 30 day sanction.  Court orders addt'l 30 days conditional jail to start 2/6, the date of hold.  Jail will calculate.  In 16CF42 on DPA, motion to revoke filed.  Court advises defendant of right to atty.  Reschedule to allow him to contact SPD office.  MH set for 3/6/18 at 3:30 p.m.
Probation review hearing on February 20, 2018 at 09:15 am.
Letter from DOC requesting Probation Review Hrg.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will enter into DAGPA on count 1 on the soon to be filed Information with a 2 yr. agreement with addt'l terms; will plead guilty to counts 2 & 3 with 2 yrs. probation, no contact provision and argue jail; counts 4 & 5 will be dismissed.  On the other matter before the court the motion to revoke pre-existing DAGPA, defendant will agree he violated the agreement, place on 1 yr. probation with condition 5 days jail consecutive the battery charges.  Court inquires why not 2 yrs. probation on that case.  Counsel agree to 2 yrs.  Atty Larimore also requests expungement.  Court informs he can't expunge dismissed charges and case with charges of conviction and dismissed charges.    State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs he has not received any communication from them.  Defendant waives his right to PH in 16CF42.  State files copy of Information with the court, defense counsel confirms receipt.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties, constitutional rights and felony prohibitions if convicted of felony.  Court summarizes the agreement with defendant.  Subject to negotiations, court revokes DPA in 15CM60, accepts defendant plea and finds him guilty.  Subject to the DPA in count 1, defendants pleads guilty; defendant pleads no contest to counts 2 & 3.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of counts 2 & 3, DRI counts 3 & 4 for restitution purposes and agreed by counsel.  Court approves DPA in count 1.  State's closing arguments and requests 2 yrs probation, 20 days jail on misdemeanor battery, 5 days on possession, no jail credit.  Defense closing argument, requests 5 days jail on drug charge and probation and straight probation on battery charges, don't think the extra 20 days are necessary.  Agree no sentence credit.  Court has few questions for defense counsel/defendant.  Court adds a condition to demonstrate responsibility by diligently seeking or maintaining F/T employment.  Under the present law I can't expunge.  When you get off probation, check with court or probation to see if the law has changed.  Your cases has mixes of convictions and dismissals and I can't expunge 1/2 of a file.  At the present time I won't approve expungement.  If law changes, the only way I would consider it is if you have no violations of probation.  In 15CM60 withhold sentence and place on 2 yrs. probation with conditions:  serve 5 days in the PCJ; provide DNA sample; pay costs believe $443; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P.  In counts 2 & 3 in 16CF42, withhold sentence place on 2 yrs. probation concurrent to eachother; provide DNA sample; pay costs on count 2, waive costs on count 3; no contact with named individuals to be provide to clerk by DA; DA indicated you intimidated a witness which he didn't charge and if its true you actively participated and threatened harm to someone else so adopt recommendation and sentence you do 20 days PCJ consecutive to the 5 days w/ work release, report 5/10 at 4:00 p.m.; set up work release ahead of time; addt'l cond:  comply with any assesssment or counseling set up by P&P; demonstrate responsibility by seeking & maintaining F/T employment.  Advised of appeal rights.
Motion hearing on May 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs defendant previously appeared in 16CF42.  Court reviews charges with defendant.  Atty Larimore requests to adjourn for 2 weeks, defendant continues to waive TL for PH in 16CF42.  Matter set for Cont'd INIT in 16CF42, note WTL, and cont'd MH in 15CM60.  Defendant confirms address as address in court file.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S.  Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.
Amended Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement

Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's Motion to Revoke DPA as defendant had a positive urine test for THC.  Atty Hillestad provided info. to the State regarding treatment efforts by Mr. Seiler an counseling.  State moves to modify terms of the agreement from 1 yr. to 2 yrs. and 80 hrs. community service.  Court notes defendant was terminated from C/S.  Atty Hillestad responds.  Court amends DPA.

Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S.  Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.
Motion hearing on April 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement
Count 2 Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 02-05-2016. Complete all hours by 07-01-2016 with minimum of 8 hours per month.   Consequences of termination from the program:  Revoke DPA

Court advises defendant of count 1/max penalties.  Court reviews DPA with defendant.  Subject to DPA, defendant pleads guilty.  Plea Colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, defers accepting plea and approve DPA.  Count 2 dismissed.

Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead to count 1, count 2 will be DRI.  Count 1 will be DPA.
Atty Patrick Waters appointed.

Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court working on DAGPA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Devin Bernard Seiler in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
